conclusion: To find the magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground, calculate the normal force N affected by the combined weight of the sled and the child, and the vertical component of the pulling force F.
Analyze the forces acting on the sled in the vertical direction: gravitational force due to sled and child, upward vertical component of pulling force, and normal force N.
Gravitational force: F_gravity = (m_sled + m_child) g with m_sled = 10 kg, m_child = 30 kg, g = 10 m/s^2.
Vertical component of pulling force: F_vertical = F sin θ with F = 100 N and sin 37° = 0.6.
Normal force N balances the net vertical forces.
Calculate vertical component of pulling force: F_vertical = 100 * 0.6 = 60 N.
Determine normal force: N = F_gravity - F_vertical = 400 - 60 = 340 N.
The magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground is 340 N.
